solution.text:
Total hours spent by Archana on the farm = \( _{j}_\frac23 = \frac{(3 \times _{j}_) + 2}3 = \frac {_{{(3*j)+2}}_}3\)
Hours spent watering the fields = \( _{k}_\frac12 = \frac{(2 \times _{k}_) + 1}2 = \frac{_{{(2*k)+1}}_}2\)
We now find the LCM of the denominators of the 2 fractions, i.e. 2 and 3
LCM of 2 and 3 = 6
Let us now write the fractions in such a way that their denominators are equal, i.e. 6, so that we can subtract them.
\( \Rightarrow \)Time spent by Archana on the farm = \( \frac {_{{(3*j)+2}}_}3 \times \frac 22 = \frac {_{{2*((3*j)+2)}}_}6 hours\)
\( \Rightarrow \) Hours spent watering the fields = \( \frac{_{{(2*k)+1}}_}2 \times \frac33 = \frac {_{{3*((2*k)+1)}}_}6 hours\)
\( \Rightarrow \) Time taken for the rest of the work = \(\frac {_{{2*((3*j)+2)}}_}6 - \frac {_{{3*((2*k)+1)}}_}6 = \frac{_{{(2*((3*j)+2)) - (3*((2*k)+1))}}_}6 hours\)

content.text: Archana works in the farm for \( _{j}_\frac 23 \) hours every day. She devotes \( _{k}_\frac 12 \) hours to watering the fields. How much time does the rest of her work take?
